jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About iVerify

We are Experts in Mobile Threat Hunting. The first mobile threat hunting company to protect mobile devices like any other vulnerable corporate endpoint.

The mobile security market has a problem. Simply put, current solutions fail to meet the sophistication of modern threats or the growing privacy desires of mobile device users. We believe that it is time for something new. Not only because we care deeply about the safety of frontline users like journalists and activists - many of whom are doing important and often dangerous work - but because enterprises and consumers deserve real protection from advanced mobile threats without sacrificing privacy.

We are building the first mobile threat hunting company to harmonize security and privacy in the face of a new class of mobile threats. Supported by some of the most well-respected VC firms, we aim to become the go-to mobile security solution for individuals who want to know they can trust their devices with their most sensitive information – without sacrificing privacy. 

About the Role

We are seeking a Data Analyst to help transform iVerify’s growing dataset into actionable insights that guide engineering, research, and product decisions.

This role sits at the intersection of data, security research, and product development, helping uncover meaningful patterns in mobile telemetry, detect anomalies, and guide decision-making across the organization.

You’ll analyze structured and semi-structured datasets from millions of mobile events, build dashboards, track key performance metrics, and help our researchers identify new threat behaviors and trends across iOS and Android devices.

Your work will directly empower our security research team to focus on investigations and detection, while ensuring our engineering team builds from data-driven insights. You’ll also help translate complex telemetry into product-level intelligence, uncover trends that inform detection strategy, and surface insights that shape how iVerify evolves its threat models and platform capabilities.

As one of the foundational members of iVerify’s data function, you’ll shape our analytics stack, define best practices, and build the pipelines and dashboards that scale with the company’s growth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Data Exploration & Analysis: Analyze large, complex mobile telemetry datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and threat patterns.

  • Dashboarding & Visualization: Build and maintain dashboards tracking platform performance, detection efficacy, and telemetry coverage.

  • Research Support: Collaborate with the security research and detection teams to design data-driven experiments and surface emerging patterns of interest.

  • Product Insights: Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that inform product decisions, customer reporting, and platform improvements.

  • Data Quality & Validation: Monitor the completeness and consistency of incoming data streams. Highlight quality issues and collaborate with the data engineering team to resolve them.

  • Reporting & Automation: Develop repeatable reporting processes and automated queries to track key performance indicators across product and detection metrics.

  • Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with engineering, machine learning, research, and customer success teams to make data accessible, explain findings, and support decisions with evidence.

  • Security Analytics Enablement: Support the creation of data-driven detections and models by providing clean, validated datasets and exploratory findings.

Day-to-Day Activities

  • Use Python and the modern data science stack(Pandas, Jupyter, NumPy, Matplotlib, or equivalent) to perform deeper statistical or exploratory analysis.

  • Build visualizations and dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio, or similar BI tools.

  • Collaborate with researchers to validate hypotheses about threat activity or telemetry anomalies.

  • Conduct ad hoc analyses to support product and detection improvements.

  • Document key findings and communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Partner with data engineers to improve dataset availability, structure, and performance for analytical workloads.

  • Work with the ML team to analyze model outputs, validate detection metrics, and support ongoing model evaluation efforts.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Product Analyst, or similar analytical role.

  • Advanced SQL skills and hands-on experience working with large datasets.

  • Strong Python proficiency for data analysis (Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter).

  • Experience building reports and visualizations with Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent BI tools.

  • Proven ability to identify trends, anomalies, and correlations within complex datasets.

  • Experience working cross-functionally with engineering, research, and product teams.

  • Excellent communication skills, able to translate technical findings into actionable business or product insights.

  • Nice to Have: Experience working with security or threat intelligence data, telemetry, or log-based systems.

  • Nice to Have: Familiarity with modern data infrastructure, such as cloud data warehouses and version-controlled analytics tools.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At iVerify, we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and community. We believe that diversity in all its forms drives innovation and fosters creativity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

jobs.title: Technical Solutions Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About iVerify

We are Experts in Mobile Threat Hunting. The first mobile threat hunting company to protect mobile devices like any other vulnerable corporate endpoint.

The mobile security market has a problem. Simply put, current solutions fail to meet the sophistication of modern threats or the growing privacy desires of mobile device users. Supported by some of the most well-respected VC firms, we aim to become the go-to mobile security solution for individuals who want to know they can trust their devices with their most sensitive information – without sacrificing privacy. 

About the Role

We are seeking a Technical Solutions Engineer to design, build, and scale integrations between the iVerify platform and our enterprise customers’ ecosystems, including MDMs, SIEMs, XDR, SOAR tools, identity providers, and incident management platforms.

This is a highly cross-functional role sitting at the intersection of engineering, customer success, and enterprise architecture. You’ll work closely with the product and platform teams to ensure our integrations, APIs, and deployment tooling are enterprise-ready, secure, and easy to adopt.

You’ll also be hands-on, developing and maintaining SDKs, REST APIs, and automation scripts, contributing to platform documentation, and supporting customers and partners as they integrate iVerify into their environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Integration Development: Design, build, and maintain integrations between iVerify and third-party systems such as:

    • MDMs (e.g., Microsoft Intune, Jamf, Kandji, Workspace ONE)

    • SIEMs and SOAR platforms (e.g., Splunk, Sentinel, QRadar, Chronicle, Cortex XSOAR)

    • XDR solutions (e.g., Microsoft Defender XDR, CrowdStrike Falcon, Palo Alto Cortex XDR, SentinelOne Singularity, Trend Vision One)

    • Identity and SSO platforms (e.g., Okta, Entra ID, Google Workspace, PingFederate)

    • Ticketing and ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira Service Management, PagerDuty)

  • API & SDK Development: Contribute to the design and implementation of iVerify’s customer-facing API, SDKs, and reference integrations. Ensure consistency, scalability, and clear documentation.

  • Scalability & Reliability: Architect integrations that scale across thousands of devices and large enterprise deployments, ensuring reliability, performance, and fault tolerance.

  • Customer Enablement: Collaborate with enterprise customers and partners to understand their environments, troubleshoot integration issues, and propose technical solutions.

  • Documentation & Developer Experience: Contribute to internal and public-facing documentation, developer guides, and API references to ensure customers and partners can easily integrate with iVerify.

  • Security & Compliance: Design integrations with a strong focus on identity, access control, and data privacy. Collaborate with the platform and security teams to ensure adherence to enterprise security standards.

  • Collaboration with Product & Engineering: Work closely with the platform, data, and mobile engineering teams to align integration capabilities with product strategy and customer needs.

Day-to-Day Activities

  • Build, test, and maintain high-quality integration code in Python and other relevant languages.

  • Develop RESTful APIs and SDKs to simplify customer and partner integrations.

  • Review and interpret third-party API documentation to design robust data exchange flows.

  • Build and manage webhook, event, and data sync frameworks between systems.

  • Work with customers’ technical teams to deploy and validate integrations in staging and production environments.

  • Establish monitoring and error-handling strategies for integrations at scale.

  • Develop reusable integration patterns and frameworks to accelerate future partnerships.

  • Contribute to internal tooling that supports deployment, observability, and operational automation.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience in integration engineering, solutions engineering, or API development roles.

  • Strong Python development skills and experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, and authentication standards (OAuth2, JWT, API keys).

  • Hands-on experience using Postman (or similar tools) for API design, testing, and validation, including environment setup, collections, and automated test scripts.

  • Proven experience designing and maintaining scalable integrations with MDMs, SIEMs, SOAR, or identity platforms.

  • Strong understanding of enterprise authentication, SSO, and provisioning workflows (SCIM, SAML, OIDC).

  • Ability to read and implement from vendor API documentation with minimal guidance.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and customer-first mindset.

  • Strong communication skills and experience collaborating with product, engineering, and customer success teams.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cybersecurity products or endpoint management systems.

  • Familiarity with event-driven architectures (e.g. Kafka, SQS, SNS, or Pub/Sub).

  • Experience building integrations into incident management, threat intelligence, or alerting systems.

  • Understanding of mobile MDM frameworks, device enrollment, and compliance policies.

  • Experience authoring public developer documentation or API reference guides.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At iVerify, we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and community. We believe that diversity in all its forms drives innovation and fosters creativity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

jobs.title: iOS Researcher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About iVerify

We are Experts in Mobile Threat Hunting. The first mobile threat hunting company to protect mobile devices like any other vulnerable corporate endpoint.

The mobile security market has a problem. Simply put, current solutions fail to meet the sophistication of modern threats or the growing privacy desires of mobile device users. We believe that it is time for something new. Not only because we care deeply about the safety of frontline users like journalists and activists - many of whom are doing important and often dangerous work - but because enterprises and consumers deserve real protection from advanced mobile threats without sacrificing privacy.

We are building the first mobile threat hunting company to harmonize security and privacy in the face of a new class of mobile threats. Supported by some of the most well-respected VC firms, we aim to become the go-to mobile security solution for individuals who want to know they can trust their devices with their most sensitive information – without sacrificing privacy. 

About the Role

We are hiring a Senior iOS Researcher to lead deep technical investigations into iOS exploitation. You will be assigned investigative tasks and research projects ranging from triaging crash reports back to potential vulnerabilities, to reversing binaries and developing controlled exploit proofs-of-concept that help us generate high-quality telemetry for detection validation.

This role is highly technical, hands-on, and research-driven. You will be responsible for conducting deep research into iOS internals, helping the team better understand how the operating system works and performing in-depth analysis of unknown or emerging vulnerabilities. Your work will directly advance our understanding of iOS threat surfaces and strengthen iVerify’s ability to detect and analyze compromises at scale.

Key Responsibilities

  • Deep iOS Internals Research Conduct deep research into iOS internals - including system daemons, security mechanisms, sandboxing,frameworks and kernel functionality to uncover how iOS operates beneath the surface.

  • Crash and Vulnerability Analysis: Investigate iOS crash reports, logs and diagnostic information to conduct root-cause analysis for crashes. Audit affected code parts to determine vulnerable code paths and potential vulnerabilities.

  • Exploit Development & Validation: Develop controlled, proof-of-concepts to reproduce known vulnerabilities and demonstrate they could be exploited.

  • Reverse Engineering & Binary Analysis: Reverse engineer key system and userland binaries to understand behavior, privilege boundaries, and potential misuse. Analyze updates and patches to identify previously undisclosed or silently fixed vulnerabilities.

  • Detection Enablement: Translate deep research findings into actionable insights, detection heuristics, or engineering requirements that strengthen our detection pipeline and threat hunting capabilities.

  • Tooling & Automation: Develop lightweight tools, scripts, or harnesses (typically in Python or Swift) to accelerate reversing, fuzzing and vulnerability research.

  • Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing: Partner with research, ML, and product teams to ensure research outputs are reproducible and production-ready. Document methodologies and findings clearly for both internal use and potential publication.

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience in security research, reversing, or vulnerability discovery with a strong focus on iOS/macOS internals.
    Deep practical knowledge of iOS internals: dyld, kernel vs userland boundaries, sandbox, entitlements, code signing, latest kernel mitigations, and system daemons.

  • Experience with exploit development, crash engineering, or fuzzing (creating deterministic crash harnesses experience in 0-Click / 1-Click attack surfaces and their exploitation is a plus.)

  • Strong C/C++ and Objective-C/Swift familiarity, able to read and reason about compiled code and runtime behaviors.

  • Comfortable developing tooling and scripts in Python or equivalent for automation and analysis.

  • Experience triaging crashes and working with Apple diagnostics and symbolication.

  • Familiarity with ARM64 assembly and Apple’s various extensions..

  • Proven reversing skills (IDA Pro, Ghidra, or Binary Ninja) and low-level debugging experience (lldb, frida).

  • Strong understanding of secure coding principles, hard and software mitigations, and how they interact with exploitation techniques.

  • Excellent technical writing skills, able to produce reproducible research notes, CVE-style reports, and triage artifacts.

  • Strong collaboration skills, experience working across engineering, data, and product teams.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At iVerify, we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and community. We believe that diversity in all its forms drives innovation and fosters creativity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About iVerify

We are Experts in Mobile Threat Hunting. The first mobile threat hunting company to protect mobile devices like any other vulnerable corporate endpoint.

The mobile security market has a problem. Simply put, current solutions fail to meet the sophistication of modern threats or the growing privacy desires of mobile device users. We believe that it is time for something new. Not only because we care deeply about the safety of frontline users like journalists and activists - many of whom are doing important and often dangerous work - but because enterprises and consumers deserve real protection from advanced mobile threats without sacrificing privacy.

We are building the first mobile threat hunting company to harmonize security and privacy in the face of a new class of mobile threats. Supported by some of the most well-respected VC firms, we aim to become the go-to mobile security solution for individuals who want to know they can trust their devices with their most sensitive information – without sacrificing privacy. 

About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Director of Engineering to lead and scale our engineering organization during a period of rapid growth and enterprise adoption.

Reporting directly to the CTO, this individual will oversee our ETL, Mobile, and Platform engineering teams, ensuring that day-to-day operations, delivery velocity, and platform reliability meet the high expectations of enterprise customers.

The Director of Engineering will bring a background in building scalable, secure platforms, ideally with prior experience in large enterprise or cybersecurity environments. This person will instill operational discipline, drive accountability through data, and ensure the engineering organization is aligned around measurable outcomes such as application performance, stability, error rates, and delivery quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Team Leadership & Management: Directly manage the ETL, Mobile, and Platform team leads, providing mentorship, strategic direction, and consistent performance oversight.

  • Operational Excellence: Oversee day-to-day engineering operations and ensure delivery on key metrics including uptime, performance, and error rates.

  • Scalability & Enterprise Readiness: Drive the evolution of our architecture and development processes to meet enterprise scale, ensuring high availability, strong security posture, and predictable delivery cycles.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with Research, Product, and Security teams to align engineering priorities with customer and organizational goals.

  • Data-Driven Reporting: Define and report on engineering KPIs to leadership, including system reliability, incident response, and release performance.

  • Platform Security & On-Prem Development: Collaborate with the CTO on platform security architecture and lead the continued development and support of our on-premise deployment offering.

  • Process Transformation: Implement and refine engineering processes to increase delivery velocity while maintaining quality, security, and compliance.

  • Talent Development: Recruit, coach, and grow high-performing engineering teams that balance innovation with operational discipline.

Strategic Goals

This role plays a critical part in driving iVerify’s broader Engineering and Research Transformation Plan, focused on evolving our structure, processes, and culture to meet the expectations of large enterprise customers.

As Director of Engineering, you will lead with a growth mindset, scaling our teams and technology to support continued platform expansion, accelerate the delivery of customer-driven capabilities, and maintain the highest standards of availability, performance, and security.

You will ensure the engineering organization operates with the discipline, maturity, and transparency required to earn the trust of enterprise customers, while preserving the speed, innovation, and agility that have been core to iVerify’s success to date.

By investing in engineering capacity, improving operational rigor, and strengthening collaboration across teams, you will help position iVerify to confidently support strategic customers, capture new opportunities, and sustain long-term growth.

Requirements

  • 10+ years of software engineering experience, including 5+ years in leadership or management roles.

  • Proven experience leading multi-disciplinary engineering teams.

  • Track record of building and scaling enterprise-grade platforms with high availability, performance, and security requirements.

  • Strong background in platform security and cloud/on-prem hybrid architectures.

  • Experience managing and reporting on engineering KPIs - including uptime, latency, error rates, and development velocity.

  • Deep understanding of software development processes (Agile, CI/CD, DevSecOps) and modern tooling.

  • Strong technical foundation in distributed systems, networking, and data pipelines.

  • Experience collaborating with Product and Security teams to align technical priorities with customer outcomes.

  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence across technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice-to-Have

  • Prior experience working within the cybersecurity or endpoint security domain.

  • Experience scaling infrastructure to meet enterprise or government customer requirements.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, and on-prem orchestration environments.

  • Background in data pipeline management (ETL, data quality, observability).

  • Experience managing teams responsible for mobile app development (iOS/Android) and backend APIs.

  • Proven success driving process improvement and organizational transformation in a high-growth environment.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At iVerify, we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and community. We believe that diversity in all its forms drives innovation and fosters creativity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

jobs.title: Technical Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About iVerify

We are Experts in Mobile Threat Hunting. The first mobile threat hunting company to protect mobile devices like any other vulnerable corporate endpoint.

The mobile security market has a problem. Simply put, current solutions fail to meet the sophistication of modern threats or the growing privacy desires of mobile device users. We believe that it is time for something new. Not only because we care deeply about the safety of frontline users like journalists and activists - many of whom are doing important and often dangerous work - but because enterprises and consumers deserve real protection from advanced mobile threats without sacrificing privacy.

We are building the first mobile threat hunting company to harmonize security and privacy in the face of a new class of mobile threats. Supported by some of the most well-respected VC firms, we aim to become the go-to mobile security solution for individuals who want to know they can trust their devices with their most sensitive information – without sacrificing privacy. 

About the Role

As our first Customer Success hire, you will shape how we onboard, support and grow our customers. This is a highly visible, hands-on role - you’ll work directly with customers’ internal teams, our Sales and Product functions, as well as Engineering to ensure smooth implementations, drive usage/product adoption and build long-term relationships.

You’ll also drive the foundation for our Customer Success motion, establishing processes, playbooks, metrics and customer programs, as we scale.

Responsibilities

Implementation & Onboarding

  • Lead technical onboarding projects for new customers: deployment planning, integrations, enrollment, and security best practices.

  • Project-manage time-to-value, coordinating across customer teams and internal stakeholders.

Adoption & Deployment

  • Drive customer deployment goals (e.g. user/device enrollment, endpoint coverage) to ensure customers realize full ROI.

  • Provide proactive guidance and training for ongoing usage.

Customer Health & Relationship Building

  • Serve as the trusted advisor to key stakeholders.

  • Establish regular check-ins (ie QBRs) and provide insights to maximize product value.

  • Design and launch our CSAT / NPS programming.

Renewals & Growth

  • Own renewals for assigned accounts

  • Identify upsell/cross-sell opportunities (e.g. additional features, licenses) and collaborate with Sales to win

Technical Support Liaison

  • Act as a first-line technical contact for support submissions

  • Troubleshoot and resolve common issues and coordinate with Product/Engineering for advanced cases.

Product Feedback & Advocacy

  • Capture and prioritize customer feedback to inform roadmap and product improvements.

  • Partner with Product to close the loop with customers.

Requirements

  • 6+ years in Customer Success, Account Management, or related client-facing role in cybersecurity.

  • Experience managing the full customer lifecycle: from onboarding and adoption through renewals, with a track record of partnering effectively with Sales on expansion opportunities.

  • Strong project management skills; comfortable coordinating across multiple teams and stakeholders.

  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills, with the ability to serve as a trusted advisor.

  • Comfort with technical concepts (integrations, security best practices, basic troubleshooting); able to translate between customer and engineering teams.

  • Data-driven mindset with experience using CS tools/metrics (e.g. NPS, health scores, usage dashboards).

  • Entrepreneurial approach: excited to build processes, playbooks, and programs from scratch in a fast-paced environment.

  • Proactive, resourceful, and comfortable wearing many hats as the first CS hire.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

At iVerify, we are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and community. We believe that diversity in all its forms drives innovation and fosters creativity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

About the Role

We’re looking for our first Sales Director to drive growth across the EMEA region. This is a senior individual contributor role designed for a self-starter who thrives in building new markets from the ground up. You’ll be responsible for developing and executing a go-to-market strategy, acquiring new customers, and building strong relationships across the MSP and VAR ecosystem. While the initial focus will be on individual quota attainment and establishing iVerify’s presence in Europe, the ideal candidate will also bring experience scaling sales teams and processes as the business grows.

Responsibilities

  • Drive iVerify’s expansion across EMEA, driving new business and establishing a strong, sustainable market presence.

  • Develop and execute a winning go-to-market plan to accelerate revenue across key EMEA markets.

  • Identify and pursue new business opportunities, leading the full sales cycle from prospecting through negotiation and close.

  • Build trusted relationships with C-level decision-makers, channel partners, and strategic accounts.

  • Cultivate and expand partnerships with Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) to drive channel growth.

  • Provide market intelligence and feedback to influence product development, pricing, and positioning in Europe.

  • As traction builds, play a key role in shaping the structure, strategy, and hiring plan for future EMEA sales growth.

Requirements

  • 8+ years of experience in B2B sales, including experience closing enterprise-level deals in cybersecurity or related SaaS sectors.

  • Proven success driving new business in the EMEA market, ideally as a first or early go-to-market hire.

  • Deep knowledge of the MSP and VAR landscape in the UK, with strong existing relationships preferred; broader EU exposure a plus.

  • Demonstrated ability to operate autonomously, build pipeline from scratch, and close deals independently.

  • Experience contributing to or building sales processes and playbooks in early-stage or scaling environments.

  • The ability to understand highly technical systems and communicate complex subjects simply.

  • Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.

  • Fluent in English; additional European languages are a strong plus.

  • Willingness to travel across the region as needed.

Compensation

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and employment type. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
